Image pathway list

Image pathway list

Provide a standard pathway to content with a supporting image.

On this page
  • Visual design
  • Guidelines for use
  • Layouts

Visual design

Label

Image pathway list

The image pathway list is an in-page link to another page on the site with a supporting image.

CSS styles

Heading
h3 {
    font-family: OpenSans-Semibold;
    font-size: 21px;
    color: #333333;
    letter-spacing: 0;
    line-height: 28px;
}
h3:hover {
    color: #254F90;
    text-decoration: underline;
}
Label
p.label {
    font-family: OpenSans;
    font-size: 12px;
    color: #333333;
    letter-spacing: 0.2px;
    line-height: 22px;
    text-transform: uppercase;
}
Description
p.description {
    font-family: OpenSans;
    font-size: 14px;
    color: #000000;
    letter-spacing: normal;
    line-height: 24px;
}
Icon link
.icon {    
    color: #254F90;
    height: 16px;
    width: 16px;
}
.icon:hover {
    color: #254F90;
    height: 32px;
    width: 32px;
}
Container
.container {
    background: #ffffff;
    padding: 16px;
    border: none;
    border-top: 4px solid #254F90;
    box-shadow: 0 0.125rem 0.75rem 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
    transition-delay:0s;
    transition-duration:0.4s;
    transition-property:all;
    transition-timing-function:ease;
}
.container:hover {
    box-shadow: 0 0.25rem 0.5rem 0 rgba(0,0,0,.2);
    transform: translateY(-4px);
}

Mobile

Description
p.description {
    font-size: 16px;
    line-height: 28px;
}

View design and assets in Adobe XD.

Guidelines for use

Coming soon.

Layouts

Page width

Image pathway list components can be used in full width and 2/3rd width pages.

Equal width layout - full width pages

Desktop: Three equal width components in a row.

Tablet: Two equal width components in a row.

Mobile: One equal component in a row.

Equal width layout - 2/3rd width pages

Desktop & tablet: Three equal width components in a row.

Mobile: One equal component in a row.
